title: betaSandwich: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: Generates robust confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients using heteroskedasticity-consistent standard errors models fitted lm() described Dudgeon (2017: http://doi.org/10.1007/s11336-017-9563-z). package can also used generate confidence intervals R-squared, adjusted R-squared, differences standardized regression coefficients. description package code examples presented Pesigan, Sun, Cheung (2023: https://doi.org/10.1080/00273171.2023.2201277).

title: betaSandwich: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: can install CRAN release betaSandwich : can install development version betaSandwich GitHub :
code: install.packages("betaSandwich") if (!require("remotes")) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("jeksterslab/betaSandwich")

title: betaSandwich: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: example, multiple regression model fitted using program quality ratings (QUALITY) regressand/outcome variable number published articles attributed program faculty members (NARTIC), percent faculty members holding research grants (PCTGRT), percentage program graduates received support (PCTSUPP) regressor/predictor variables using data set 1982 ratings 46 doctoral programs psychology USA (National Research Council, 1982). Robust confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients generated using BetaHC() function betaSandwich package following Dudgeon (2017).
code: library(betaSandwich) df <- betaSandwich::nas1982

what: Fit the regression model using the lm() function.
title: betaSandwich: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)

what: Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding robust sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaSandwich: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
code: BetaHC(object, type = "hc3", alpha = 0.05) ## Call: ## BetaHC(object = object, type = "hc3", alpha = 0.05) ##  ## Standardized regression slopes with HC3 standard errors: ##            est     se      t df      p   2.5%  97.5% ## NARTIC  0.4951 0.0786 6.3025 42 0.0000 0.3366 0.6537 ## PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0818 4.7831 42 0.0000 0.2263 0.5567 ## PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0855 3.0786 42 0.0037 0.0907 0.4358

title: betaSandwich: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: package can also used generate confidence intervals R-squared, adjusted R-squared, differences standardized regression coefficients.

title: betaSandwich: Example Using the BetaHC Function
code: BetaHC(object, type = "hc3", alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> BetaHC(object = object, type = "hc3", alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Standardized regression slopes with HC3 standard errors: #>            est     se      t df      p   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4951 0.0786 6.3025 42 0.0000 0.3366 0.6537 #> PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0818 4.7831 42 0.0000 0.2263 0.5567 #> PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0855 3.0786 42 0.0037 0.0907 0.4358

title: betaSandwich: Example Using the BetaHC Function
code: out <- BetaHC(object, type = "hc3", alpha = 0.05)

title: betaSandwich: Example Using the BetaHC Function
text: Summary results BetaHC().

title: betaSandwich: Example Using the BetaHC Function
text: Calculate standardized regression slopes.
code: coef(out) #>    NARTIC    PCTGRT   PCTSUPP  #> 0.4951451 0.3914887 0.2632477

what: Estimate differences of standardized regression slopes and the corresponding sampling covariance matrix.
title: betaSandwich: Example Using the DiffBetaSandwich Function
code: mvn <- DiffBetaSandwich(std_mvn, alpha = 0.05) adf <- DiffBetaSandwich(std_adf, alpha = 0.05) hc3 <- DiffBetaSandwich(std_hc3, alpha = 0.05)

title: betaSandwich: Example Using the DiffBetaSandwich Function
text: Summary results DiffBetaSandwich().

title: betaSandwich: Example Using the DiffBetaSandwich Function
text: Calculate differences standardized regression slopes.
code: coef(mvn) #>  NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  #>      0.1036564      0.2318974      0.1282410 coef(adf) #>  NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  #>      0.1036564      0.2318974      0.1282410 coef(hc3) #>  NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  #>      0.1036564      0.2318974      0.1282410

title: betaSandwich: Example Using the DiffBetaSandwich Function
text: Calculate sampling covariance matrix differences standardized regression slopes.
code: vcov(mvn) #>                NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP #> NARTIC-PCTGRT    0.018408653    0.009511262   -0.008897391 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP   0.009511262    0.015672035    0.006160773 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  -0.008897391    0.006160773    0.015058164 vcov(adf) #>                NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP #> NARTIC-PCTGRT    0.014681407    0.006928651   -0.007752755 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP   0.006928651    0.013938955    0.007010303 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  -0.007752755    0.007010303    0.014763058 vcov(hc3) #>                NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP #> NARTIC-PCTGRT    0.020076382    0.009274583   -0.010801799 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP   0.009274583    0.017370731    0.008096148 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  -0.010801799    0.008096148    0.018897947

what: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
title: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan 2025-07-22

title: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: Generates robust confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients using heteroskedasticity-consistent standard errors models fitted lm() described Dudgeon (2017: http://doi.org/10.1007/s11336-017-9563-z). package can also used generate confidence intervals R-squared, adjusted R-squared, differences standardized regression coefficients. description package code examples presented Pesigan, Sun, Cheung (2023: https://doi.org/10.1080/00273171.2023.2201277).

title: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: can install CRAN release betaSandwich : can install development version betaSandwich GitHub :
code: install.packages("betaSandwich") if (!require("remotes")) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("jeksterslab/betaSandwich")

title: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
text: example, multiple regression model fitted using program quality ratings (QUALITY) regressand/outcome variable number published articles attributed program faculty members (NARTIC), percent faculty members holding research grants (PCTGRT), percentage program graduates received support (PCTSUPP) regressor/predictor variables using data set 1982 ratings 46 doctoral programs psychology USA (National Research Council, 1982). Robust confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients generated using BetaHC() function betaSandwich package following Dudgeon (2017).
code: library(betaSandwich) df <- betaSandwich::nas1982

what: Fit the regression model using the lm() function.
title: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)

what: Estimate the standardized regression slopes and the corresponding robust sampling covariance matrix.
title: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients
code: BetaHC(object, type = "hc3", alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> BetaHC(object = object, type = "hc3", alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Standardized regression slopes with HC3 standard errors: #>            est     se      t df      p   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4951 0.0786 6.3025 42 0.0000 0.3366 0.6537 #> PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0818 4.7831 42 0.0000 0.2263 0.5567 #> PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0855 3.0786 42 0.0037 0.0907 0.4358

title: Estimate Differences of Standardized Slopes and the Corresponding Sampling Covariance Matrix — DiffBetaSandwich
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = nas1982) std <- BetaHC(object) diff <- DiffBetaSandwich(std) # Methods ------------------------------------------------------- print(diff) #> Call: #> DiffBetaSandwich(object = std) #>  #> Difference between standardized regression coefficients with HC3 standard errors: #>                   est     se      z      p   0.05%    0.5%    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1417 0.7316 0.4644 -0.3626 -0.2613 -0.1741 0.3814 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1318 1.7595 0.0785 -0.2018 -0.1076 -0.0264 0.4902 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1375 0.9329 0.3509 -0.3241 -0.2259 -0.1412 0.3977 #>                 99.5% 99.95% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.4686 0.5699 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.5714 0.6656 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.4823 0.5806 summary(diff) #>                   est     se      z      p   0.05%    0.5%    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1417 0.7316 0.4644 -0.3626 -0.2613 -0.1741 0.3814 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1318 1.7595 0.0785 -0.2018 -0.1076 -0.0264 0.4902 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1375 0.9329 0.3509 -0.3241 -0.2259 -0.1412 0.3977 #>                 99.5% 99.95% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.4686 0.5699 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.5714 0.6656 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.4823 0.5806 coef(diff) #>  NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  #>      0.1036564      0.2318974      0.1282410  vcov(diff) #>                NARTIC-PCTGRT NARTIC-PCTSUPP PCTGRT-PCTSUPP #> NARTIC-PCTGRT    0.020076382    0.009274583   -0.010801799 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP   0.009274583    0.017370731    0.008096148 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP  -0.010801799    0.008096148    0.018897947 confint(diff, level = 0.95) #>                      2.5 %    97.5 % #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  -0.17405314 0.3813660 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP -0.02642203 0.4902169 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP -0.14119483 0.3976769

what: betaSandwich: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients — betaSandwich-package
title: betaSandwich: Robust Confidence Intervals for Standardized Regression Coefficients — betaSandwich-package
text: Generates robust confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients using heteroskedasticity-consistent standard errors models fitted lm() described Dudgeon (2017) doi:10.1007/s11336-017-9563-z . package can also used generate confidence intervals R-squared, adjusted R-squared, differences standardized regression coefficients. description package code examples presented Pesigan, Sun, Cheung (2023) doi:10.1080/00273171.2023.2201277 .
